channel.title: Adding an item to a shop
channel.description: i was pretty sure of how to add an item to a shop, by opening the shops.cfg, then adding the item id and how many you want in the shop, in line with the name of the shop you want it to be in, but for some reason i get an error. (see shopserror.jpg) so i went back to my shops.cfg, to see what the problem was, but i can't see a problem, can you? (see shopscfg.jpg) help! thanks :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 27, 2009, 02:43:53 pm[/size][hr]anyone?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 27, 2009, 02:52:57 pm[/size][hr]... please?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 27, 2009, 03:08:41 pm[/size][hr]bump[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 27, 2009, 03:18:09 pm[/size][hr]omg! really? no one?

item.title: Adding an item to a shop
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Always use tabs within configuration files, as Pk3r John stated above.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding an item to a shop
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

Don’t “bump”. It’s against the rules, and replying like that won’t get your thread bumped.

And make sure you pressed tab and not space.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding an item to a shop
item.dc:creator: @HAIGUYS HAIGUYS
item.description:
@HAIGUYS wrote:

i was pretty sure of how to add an item to a shop, by opening the shops.cfg, then adding the item id and how many you want in the shop, in line with the name of the shop you want it to be in, but for some reason i get an error. (see shopserror.jpg)
so i went back to my shops.cfg, to see what the problem was, but i can’t see a problem, can you? (see shopscfg.jpg)
help! thanks :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 27, 2009, 02:43:53 pm[/size][hr]anyone?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 27, 2009, 02:52:57 pm[/size][hr]… please?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 27, 2009, 03:08:41 pm[/size][hr]bump[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 27, 2009, 03:18:09 pm[/size][hr]omg! really? no one?
